meanings.definition: To grab or hold someone or something by the back of the neck or the loose skin around the neck.
meanings.sent1: The mother cat was scruffing her kitten to move it to a safer place.
meanings.sent2: He was scruffing the mischievous puppy to stop it from running away.
meanings.sent3: The magician pretended to be scruffing the invisible rabbit by the neck.
meanings.sent4: The coach was scruffing the player's attention during the intense game.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was scruffing the chicken gently to carry it to the coop.

meanings.definition: The act of seizing or gripping someone or something by the scruff.
meanings.sent1: The kitten was dangling by the scruffing after the mother cat's swift move.
meanings.sent2: The scruffing of the cat by the vet was done carefully to avoid any discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot had a tiny hand that could perform scruffing on small objects.
meanings.sent4: The scruffing of the doll by the child showed how gentle they could be.
meanings.sent5: The scruffing of the document by the clerk indicated its importance in the office.
